channel.description: YouTube Video Resources Slides Of course, we can also read numerical input in Python using the input() function. To do this, we must simply use either the int() or float() function to convert the input received as a string to the correct data type. Hereâ€™s a quick example program that requires two inputs for the price and quantity of an item being purchased: text_one = input("Enter the price of one item: ") price = float(text_one) text_two = input("Enter the quantity of items: ") quantity = int(text_two) cost = price * quantity print("The total cost is $", end="") print(cost) If the user wishes to purchase $ 3 $ items at the price of $ 2.
